manifest.name: hast-util-has-property
manifest.description: Check if a node has a property

scripts.build: npm run build-md && npm run build-bundle && npm run build-mangle
scripts.test: npm run build && npm run lint && npm run test-coverage

manifest.readme:
# hast-util-has-property [![Build Status][build-badge]][build-page] [![Coverage Status][coverage-badge]][coverage-page]

Check whether a [HAST node][hast] is an [element][] with a [property][].

## Installation

[npm][]:

```bash
npm install hast-util-has-property
```

## Usage

```javascript
var has = require('hast-util-has-property');

has({type: 'text', value: 'alpha'}, 'bravo'); //=> false

has({
  type: 'element',
  tagName: 'div',
  properties: {id: 'bravo'},
  children: []
}, 'className'); //=> false

has({
  type: 'element',
  tagName: 'div',
  properties: {id: 'charlie'},
  children: []
}, 'id'); // => true
```

## API

### `hasProperty(node, name)`

Check if `node` has a set `name` property.

###### Parameters

*   `node` ([`Node`][node], optional) — Node to check.
*   `name` ([`string`][property]) - Property name to check.

###### Returns

`boolean` — Whether `node` is an [`Element`][element] with a property
by `name`.

## Contribute

See [`contribute.md` in `syntax-tree/hast`][contribute] for ways to get
started.

This organisation has a [Code of Conduct][coc].  By interacting with this
repository, organisation, or community you agree to abide by its terms.

## License

[MIT][license] © [Titus Wormer][author]
